attributes.additional_details: In january 2021 I was paying £1.04 a litre the price has dramatically increase to £1.60, ridiculous! The government reduced it by 5p a litre and went to £1.55 but it has again increased to £1.66 more than what it was when you made any reduction it now costs Me almost 20% of my salary just to get to work and considering all the recent price hikes I might not be able to afford to go to work
attributes.background: I want the government to reduce tax on fuel and help drive the petrol providers to reduce the cost of what we pay

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Government isn't responsible for setting the price of fuel. This is a matter for suppliers.

You might like to sign the following petitions, which call for related actions:

Set up an independent regulator to monitor and regulate vehicle fuel pricing
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605282

Hold an inquiry into fuel prices and introduce increased regulation
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/603624

Cap profit fuel forecourt operators can make on petrol and diesel to 10p/litre
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616956

Suspend VAT on road fuels to reduce fuel costs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610567

Remove duty on motor fuel completely
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613908
